title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Distributions

Figure 1: Distributions for All Tasks. They are all all fairly distributed as normal.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Missing Pattern

Figure 2: Misssing pattern. Stop signal task has slightly more missing values. Subjects with missing values at more than 20% of tasks are removed in further analysis.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:

Figure 3: Correlation Between Tasks

text:
The promising models







Figure 4: Common Factor Model










Figure 5: Bi-Factor Model

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
section: Correlation with scores of all-variable model
text:
Correlation with scores of all-variable model

Figure 6: Correlation distribution of simulations with different number of selected variables. Each point is the correlation between estimated general factor scores from selected variables and those from all 20 variables. Note there are a number of negative correlations for 3 to 9 variable simulation.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Correlation with RAPM

Figure 7: Correlation with RAPM scores for each simulation. The dotted red line the result of g scores estimated from all variables. Note there are negative correlations for simulations with 3-9.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
section: Correlation between each pair of g-factor estimation
text:
Correlation between each pair of g-factor estimation

Figure 8: Trending of correlation between each pair of g-factor scores.

Is it possible that with a larger sets of variables, the pattern will be different?
Note the “reliability” of g-factor scores is relatively low for 10 variables.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Predictive Network Overlapping







Figure 9: Trending of the overlap between pairs of preditive networks. Results are based on CPM.










Figure 10: Trending of the overlap between pairs of preditive networks. Only include positive intra-pair correlation simulations.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Neural Prediction Based on CPM

Figure 11: Trending of neural prediction. Results are based on CPM. The red dotted line is the result from Raven score. The green dotted line is the result of factor scores estimated from all variables.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Prediction by global efficiency

Figure 12: Trending of global efficiency prediction. Basically, the global efficiency can not predict these g scores. The red dotted line is the result from Raven score. The green dotted line is the result of factor scores estimated from all variables.

title: G-Factor Scores’ Neural Predictability
text:
Absolute Edge Counts







Figure 13: Chord Diagram of Networks predict g-factor scores. Link width corresponds to the number of edges.










Figure 14: Chord Diagram of Networks predict Raven scores. Link width corresponds to the number of edges.

text:
Relative Edge Counts







Figure 15: Chord Diagram of Networks predict g-factor scores. Link width corresponds to the relative number of edges (divided by total edges).










Figure 16: Chord Diagram of Networks predict Raven scores. Link width corresponds to the relative number of edges (divided by total edges).
